transcript.text: Chris Knobblock is the head coach of the
Eerie Otter, the team that McDavid
currently plays for. He joins us by
phone from Erie, Pennsylvania. And
Chris, I know you're about to head into
practice shortly with Connor and the
rest of the team. What do you think
you'll say to him?
Um, I'm not sure. Um, I'm going to see
him in probably about 5 minutes there,
right after this phone call. And uh, um,
yeah, I don't sure. I'm sure he's a
little excited and um, maybe a little
bit relieved and now he knows where he's
most likely going. So, um, yeah, we'll
just see how it goes. What was your
reaction when you heard that Edmonton
had won the draft lottery? Um, well, um,
you know, I didn't have any preferences
where he went or I I think there'll be
an excellent opportunity for him there
and um um I don't know, it's a little
bit ironic what's going on with our team
and the Edmonton Oilers, but um, you
know, I think wherever Connor is going
to go, he will thrive and be a an
excellent NHL player. Why is it ironic?
Uh just with our uh our team, our
financial situation of uh and um the
transfer of ownership, what was almost
happened with the Edmonton Oilers and uh
now that our star player going to uh
Edmonton, do you do you think Connor had
a preference of where he would end up?
Um I don't think so. I think uh maybe a
little bit of being a a Toronto guy um
growing up there, but uh I I I don't
think he had a preference of where he
went uh or any places that he had
scratched off his list. So, um yeah, no,
I think he's open to wherever he's
going. Um he's kind of in the same
situation being a 15-year-old coming
into our league of you know not choosing
a lot of players in the Ontario Hockey
League sometimes choose where they go
and where they not. Connor never done
that and has no understood that it's
part of uh hockey just to go wherever
you're drafted and not be um particular
what city you choose. What makes him a
great player?
Well, I think it's just his he has
exceptional talents and there's players
that can shoot the puck really well or
stick handle and skate and have great on
ice awareness. Um Connor, what makes him
special is he's got all of that. And
when you you put it all together, you
get the the Conor McDavid uh product
where he's just a exceptional hockey
player. Do you think when people start
saying he they compare him to Gretky,
they compare him to Crosby, they compare
him to Lemieux. Is that fair? Is that Is
he in that league? Um I think he's going
to be in an excellent hockey player and
uh just to say he's the next um Sydney
Crosby or Wayne Gretzky, I think it's
really unfair. Um he's a one heck of a
hockey player and he will be successful.
So I think Connor will write his story
and he will dictate of how good he's
going to be. What's he like as a guy?
He is a great guy and sometimes you get
uh players with exceptional talent and
have some uh um arrogance to them or
feel that they're entitled to certain
things and Connor is none of that. He's
a team first guy, a player um who's just
a perfect player to coach. Um where he's
you have somebody who has exceptional
talent, but he's a team first guy. The
players on the team love him being
around with him. He's one of the most
popular guys, but he's he's cares about
winning first and his performance
second. Chris, good to speak with you.
Thank you very much. Well, thanks for
having me. Chris Knobblock is the head
coach of the Eerie Otter.

What was your reaction when you heard that Edmonton had won the draft lottery? Um I don't think so. So, um yeah, no, I think he's open to wherever he's going. Um Connor, what makes him special is he's got all of that. And when you you put it all together, you get the the Conor McDavid uh product where he's just a exceptional hockey player. Do you think when people start saying he they compare him to Gretky, they compare him to Crosby, they compare him to Lemieux. Is that fair? Is that Is he in that league? Um I think he's going to be in an excellent hockey player and uh just to say he's the next um Sydney Crosby or Wayne Gretzky, I think it's really unfair. The players on the team love him being around with him. He's one of the most popular guys, but he's he's cares about winning first and his performance second. Chris, good to speak with you. Thank you very much. Well, thanks for having me. Chris Knobblock is the head coach of the Eerie Otter.
video_title: Connor McDavid, the player everyone calls the next Sidney Crosby
